title: 112_hr5188
content: The "Ensuring Child Care for Working Families Act of 2012" amends Section 418 of the Social Security Act to provide funding for child care. The "Ensuring Child Care for Working Families Act of 2012" amends Section 418 of the Social Security Act to provide child care assistance payments to states based on specific criteria. The Secretary will use appropriated funds to provide grants to States, Indian tribes, and tribal organizations for guaranteed child care assistance. Additionally, the Secretary will match state expenditures exceeding historical levels. The Secretary will use appropriated funds to provide grants for child care assistance, matching state expenditures exceeding historical levels. The Secretary will use reported information to determine expenditures for child care assistance, which must be used solely for that purpose without fiscal year limitation. States must guarantee child care for certain populations to receive funds. Child care assistance approved under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act guarantees support for families with dependent children, as long as their income is below 200 percent of the poverty line. This assistance helps individuals in the family to secure employment, stay employed, or engage in education or training activities. The Child Care and Development Block Grant Act provides child care assistance to families with dependent children below 200 percent of the poverty line, enabling them to secure employment, stay employed, or engage in education or training activities. Amounts provided to a State under this Act are transferred to the lead agency and subject to its requirements and limitations. Regulations will be implemented by the Secretary to enforce this section, with the amendment taking effect on the 1st day of the 1st fiscal year after a 12-month period from the enactment of the Act.
